intro: Echinops blanchianus, commonly known as the white thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its spiky, spherical seed heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer. Echinops blanchianus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
